sections.name: Keel
sections.content: The keel is the main structural backbone running along the bottom of the ship. All major structural members are built around it.

sections.name: Bulkhead
sections.content: A bulkhead is a vertical partition that divides a ship into watertight compartments to improve strength and safety.

sections.name: Deck Beam
sections.content: Deck beams support deck plating and maintain the transverse strength of the vessel.

materials.name: Mild Steel
materials.content: Used widely in hull structures due to weldability and good strength.

materials.name: High Tensile Steel
materials.content: Provides higher strength with reduced weight, used in tankers and container ships.

machinery.name: Main Engine (2-Stroke)
machinery.content: The primary propulsion engine, slow-speed, crosshead type, running on heavy fuel oil or low-sulphur fuel.

machinery.name: Purifier
machinery.content: A centrifugal separator used to remove water and impurities from fuel oil.

machinery.name: Freshwater Generator
machinery.content: Produces fresh water from seawater using evaporation and condensation.

steering_thrusters.name: Rudder
steering_thrusters.content: Main steering device located aft, controlled by the steering gear.

steering_thrusters.name: Bow Thruster
steering_thrusters.content: Provides lateral thrust for easier port manoeuvring.

equipment.name: Windlass
equipment.content: Used to hoist and lower the anchor and manage the chain cable.

equipment.name: Mooring Winch
equipment.content: Used for mooring line control during berthing operations.

safety.name: Immersion Suit
safety.content: Protects the wearer from hypothermia in cold waters.

safety.name: Fire Detection System
safety.content: Detects smoke, heat, or flame and activates alarms.

regulations.name: SOLAS
regulations.content: International maritime treaty ensuring safety of life at sea through rules and standards.

regulations.name: MARPOL
regulations.content: Regulation controlling ship pollution from oil, chemicals, sewage, garbage, and air emissions.

innovations.name: Hydrogen Fuel Propulsion
innovations.content: Uses hydrogen fuel cells for near-zero-emission ship propulsion.

innovations.name: Wind-Assisted Propulsion
innovations.content: Rotor sails and kites reduce fuel consumption and emissions.

innovations.name: Digital Twin Systems
innovations.content: A virtual model of the ship used for monitoring, predictive maintenance, and performance optimization.

training.name: BRM
training.content: Bridge Resource Management for safe navigation and communication.

training.name: ERM
training.content: Engine Room Resource Management focusing on teamwork and communication.
